content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Solved 4 minutes in python. I found this puzzle intuitive. Used a nested loop and this condition ((x_1<=x<=x_2) and (y_1==y or y==y_2)) or ((y_1<=y<=y_2) and (x_1==x or x==x_2))

I think this question will work for all three modes given the stub. If I were to be critical I think this question could benefit from an additional test case because test4 and validator4 are slightly different. However, I cannot think of a scenario where validator4 fails while test4 passes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and simple

The following note section in the description should be highlighted IMO which is key for this problem.
"Note that the rectangle may be outside of the drawing area."

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle to solve. Approving it but the puzzle might not be solvable within 5 mins due to the clipped rectangle constrained. User can easily missed that at first place.

Nice one! The problem looks trivial at first sight but handling clipped rectangle is a good exercise. Perfect fit for CoC. Here is my code btw :)

width, height = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
x1, y1 = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
x2, y2 = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
g = [['.']*width for _ in range(height)]

for i in range(y1,y2+1):
    for j in range(x1,x2+1):
        if i < 0 or j < 0 or i >= height or j >= width: continue
        if i > y1 and i < y2 and j > x1 and j < x2: continue
        g[i][j]='#'

for i in range(height):
    for j in range(width):
        print(g[i][j],end='')
    print()
Glad you like it. Ok I've added the bold style.
